events.originalText: A hydroelectric turbine at the Sayano-Shushenskaya Dam in Russia catastrophically failed, flooding the turbine hall, killing 75 people and causing widespread power outages.
events.subtitle: Water turbine
events.headline: Sayano-Shushenskaya Dam Turbine Failure Kills 75 in Russia

events.originalText: Michael Phelps won his eighth gold medal of the Beijing Summer Olympics, the most golds by any person at a single games.
events.subtitle: Michael Phelps
events.headline: Michael Phelps Makes History with Eighth Gold Medal in Beijing Olympics

events.originalText: Hurricane Camille struck the Mississippi coast of the United States, killing 259 people and causing $1.42 billion in damage..
events.subtitle: Hurricane Camille
events.headline: Hurricane Camille Devastates Mississippi Coast, 259 Dead

events.originalText: American musician Miles Davis released Kind of Blue, which became one of the best-selling and most critically acclaimed jazz recordings of all time.
events.subtitle: Miles Davis
events.headline: Miles Davis Releases Best-Selling Jazz Album 'Kind of Blue'

events.originalText: Korean War: Forty-two American prisoners of war were massacred by the Korean People's Army on a hill above Waegwan, South Korea.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Korean War Massacre: 42 American POWs Killed by Korean People's Army

events.originalText: The independence of Indonesia was proclaimed by Sukarno and Mohammad Hatta , igniting a revolution against the Dutch Empire.
events.subtitle: Proclamation of Indonesian Independence
events.headline: Indonesia Proclaimed Independence, Revolution Against Dutch Empire Begins

events.originalText: Animal Farm, George Orwell's satirical allegory of Soviet totalitarianism, was first published.
events.subtitle: Animal Farm
events.headline: George Orwell's 'Animal Farm' Published, Satirical Allegory of Soviet Totalitarianism

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Air Force began a strategic bombing campaign against Nazi Germany's V-weapon programme by attacking the Peenemünde Army Research Center.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: RAF Begins Strategic Bombing Campaign Against Nazi V-Weapon Program

events.originalText: Winston Churchill and Franklin D. Roosevelt met in a highly secret military conference (pictured) held in Quebec City.
events.subtitle: Winston Churchill
events.headline: Churchill and Roosevelt Hold Secret Military Conference in Quebec City

events.originalText: World War I: Romania signed a secret treaty with the Entente Powers, agreeing to enter the war in return for promised territory in Austria-Hungary.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Romania Signs Treaty with Entente Powers to Enter World War I

events.originalText: American Jew Leo Frank was lynched by a mob of prominent citizens in Marietta, Georgia, for the alleged murder of a 13-year-old girl.
events.subtitle: American Jews
events.headline: American Jew Leo Frank Lynched in Georgia for Alleged Murder

events.originalText: A category 4 hurricane made landfall in Galveston, Texas, leaving at least 275 people dead and causing $50 million in damage.
events.subtitle: 1915 Galveston hurricane
events.headline: Category 4 Hurricane Hits Galveston, Texas, 275 Dead

events.originalText: World War I: Ignoring orders to retreat, Hermann von François led a successful counterattack defending East Prussia at the Battle of Stallupönen and scored the first German victory in the Eastern Front.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German Victory at Battle of Stallupönen in World War I Eastern Front

events.originalText: Pike Place Market , one of the oldest continuously operated public farmers' markets in the U.S. and a popular tourist attraction, opened in Seattle, Washington.
events.subtitle: Pike Place Market
events.headline: Pike Place Market Opens in Seattle, Washington

events.originalText: Scanian War: Swedish forces defeated Danish troops at the Battle of Halmstad.
events.subtitle: Scanian War
events.headline: Swedish Forces Defeat Danish Troops at Battle of Halmstad

events.originalText: The Scottish Reformation Parliament approved a Protestant confession of faith, initiating the Scottish Reformation and disestablishing Catholicism as the national religion.
events.subtitle: Scottish Reformation Parliament
events.headline: Scottish Reformation Parliament Initiates Scottish Reformation

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: Allied English and Burgundian forces gained a strategically important victory at the bloody Battle of Verneuil  in Normandy, France.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: Allied Forces Win Battle of Verneuil in Hundred Years' War

events.originalText: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars: The Bulgarians defeated Byzantine forces at the Battle of the Gates of Trajan near present-day Ihtiman, with Emperor Basil II barely escaping.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars
events.headline: Bulgarians Defeat Byzantine Forces at Battle of the Gates of Trajan
